name: Champurrado
author: monmedel
ingredients: 2  tablets Mexican chocolate (such as Chocolate Ibarra®)
¾ cup pinole (coarse ground maize flour)
1 pinch crushed piloncillo (Mexican brown sugar cone), or more to taste
directions: Bring water, cinnamon stick, clove, and star anise to a boil in a saucepan; remove from heat and allow spices to steep until water is fragrant, about 10 minutes
Heat milk, chocolate, and pinole in another saucepan over medium heat, whisking until chocolate is dissolved and liquid is thickened, about 10 minutes
Remove from heat and add piloncillo; let rest until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes more
Pour cinnamon water into chocolate mixture and stir to combine
